overview_of_class: From search engine rankings to product recommendations, from news feeds to loan considerations, from romantic prospects to job prospects, behind-the-scenes processes whose details are rarely known to the user are increasingly influencing people's and organizations' actions. This course explores the social implications of this phenomenon in the digital age.

overview_of_class: This course introduces students to contextual interviewing and observation techniques for understanding the design and use of digital media. Weekly readings and class discussion will teach students to conduct contextual interviews, make and interpret observations, and analyze qualitative data with the aim of improving digital media design. Assignments will focus on practical application of the skills learned in the course. Students are encouraged to pick project topics of personal interest relating to technology and digital media.
